meanings.definition: The act or process of separating into fractions.
meanings.sent1: The fractionations of the mixture were done carefully in the lab.
meanings.sent2: I studied the fractionations of the liquid to understand its components.
meanings.sent3: The chef's fractionations of the cake layers made it look like a delicious rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her fractionations of time between work and play were well-balanced.
meanings.sent5: The fractionations of colors in the painting created a beautiful gradient effect.

meanings.definition: The result of separating into fractions.
meanings.sent1: The scientist analyzed the fractionations to determine the composition of the substance.
meanings.sent2: The fractionations in the data revealed interesting patterns.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected fractionations in the cookie jar left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The fractionations of wealth in society can lead to inequality.
meanings.sent5: The fractionations of light through the prism produced a spectrum of colors.
